Osu is a contraction of the words: 押し oshi meaning "push", and 忍ぶ shinobu meaning "to endure". It means patience, determination and perseverance. We can keep going even when we want to stop. ‘Osu’ is a simple word, it's easy to say it even when breathing heavily in hard exercise. ‘Osu’ shows respect, agreement, obedience, understanding, enthusiasm, striving, perseverance, endurance, patience. ‘Osu’ keeps things simple in the dojo and removes the need for more complex utterances that would distract from the training. We can use the feeling of ‘Osu’ to keep going through other challenges in our lives.

katsujin-ken is ‘saving the enemy’, literally ‘the sword that saves’. It is a principle of non-violence. Aikido can be one of the gentlest martial arts, and it is useful for security, policing, nursing, bouncing, and self-defence, where it is important not to kill or injure anyone. In contrast we have 殺人剣 setsunin-ken, the sword that kills. "Kenjsutsu is not the methods to kill a people. It is the methods to live with peace."

term: 正勝 吾勝 勝早日
English: True victory is self-victory, victory at the speed of sunlight.
definition: ‘Masakatsu agatsu katsuhayabi’. True victory is self-victory, immediate victory - ‘agatsu’ means self-victory, we are trying to improve ourselves through our budo training, and it is a great victory when we can overcome our weaknesses and gain control of ourselves. This is more important than defeating an opponent.

first learn, then detach, and finally transcend. Aikido master Endō Seishirō shihan stated: "It is known that, when we learn or train in something, we pass through the stages of shu, ha, and ri. These stages are explained as follows. In shu, we repeat the forms and discipline ourselves so that our bodies absorb the forms that our forebears created. We remain faithful to these forms with no deviation. Next, in the stage of ha, once we have disciplined ourselves to acquire the forms and movements, we make innovations. In this process the forms may be broken and discarded. Finally, in ri, we completely depart from the forms, open the door to creative technique, and arrive in a place where we act in accordance with what our heart/mind desires, unhindered while not overstepping laws."
